## The effect of global change on organisms
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 60%;">

- **Hammer strikes have different characteristics**
    + Global change stressors can vary in magnitude, velocity, etc.

<br/>

- **Nails have different characteristics**
    + Organisms vary in their vulnerability to global change stressors

<br/>

- **Also… the nail can influence the hammer**
    + Living things can respond to global change stressors and affect the entire system

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:260px; LEFT:720px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/nail.jpg">

## The effect of global change on organisms
<hr>
<br/>

<div align="center">**Organisms have different elements of “vulnerability”**</div>
<br/>
**The degree to which a system is susceptible to adverse effects of global change is a function of:**

<br/>

- **<span style="color:blue">Exposure</span>: The character, magnitude and rate of a perturbation**
    + How hard & fast does the hammer hit?

<br/>

- **<span style="color:blue">Sensitivity</span>: Degree the system changes from a given perturbation**
    + Is the nail fragile or robust?

<br/>

- **<span style="color:blue">Response</span>: Ability of a system to respond from perturbation**
    + Can the nail bounce back?

## The "Adjacent Possible' Theory - Stuart Kauffman
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 60%;">

- **Theory proposes that biological systems are able to morph into more complex systems by making incremental, relatively less energy consuming changes in their make up**
    + <span style="color:blue">small steps rather than extreme jumps or more distant possibilities</span>

<br/>

- **Kauffman was particularly interested in the origins of order and the mechanisms that drive self-organization, via evolution**
    + how the *actual* expands into the *adjacent possible*

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:160px; LEFT:675px; WIDTH:333px; HEIGHT:500px" SRC="images/origins.jpg">

## The "Adjacent Possible' theory - Stuart Kauffman
<hr>
<br/>
<div align="center">How the *actual* expands into the *adjacent possible*</div>

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 55%;">

- **The *actual* describes the system in its current state, with all its components and interconnections**

<br/>

- **The *adjacent possible* contains the set of possibilities available to individuals, communities, institutions, organisms, productive processes, etc., at a given point in time during their evolutions**

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:240px; LEFT:630px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/possible.png">

## The adjacent possible for other species
<hr>
<br/>

**If environmental conditions are changing…<span style="color:darkred">what are the adjacent possible options for survival?</span>**

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

<br/>

**In physical space -> <span style="color:blue">move</span>**

<br/>

**In physiological / behavioral space -> <span style="color:blue">adjust</span>**

<br/>

**In genetic / adaptive space -> <span style="color:blue">adapt</span>**

<br/>

**If no adjacent possible -> <span style="color:blue">die</span>**

<br/>

**<span style="color:darkred">Responses are not mutually exclusive</span>**
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:520px; WIDTH:550px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/polar.jpg">
